summary: Email chain between prosecutors and defense attorneys regarding discovery production in the case US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330). The emails discuss logistics for picking up a hard drive containing new discovery, scheduling a review session for Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC using an FBI secure laptop, and note a disclosure about a witness statement.

persons.name: Christian Everdell

events.title: Federal holiday affecting logistics

events.title: Discovery production available
events.description: A hard drive containing new discovery in US v. Maxwell is made available for pickup at One St. Andrew's Plaza.

events.title: Proposed FBI secure laptop review session
events.description: Defense requests to schedule a full-day review session for Ghislaine Maxwell at the MDC using an FBI secure laptop from 9am to 3pm.

locations: One St. Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
keyFacts: A new discovery production in US v. Maxwell (20 Cr. 330) was made available on November 9, 2020, on a hard drive for pickup at One St. Andrew's Plaza.
The discovery includes a disclosure regarding a witness statement on page 5 of an accompanying letter.
The defense team was coordinating to have the discovery, along with prior productions, sent to the MDC for Ghislaine Maxwell's review.
The defense requested to schedule a full-day review session for Maxwell at the MDC using an FBI secure laptop on Wednesday, November 11, 2020.
The email chain involves multiple defense attorneys: Christian Everdell, Mark S. Cohen, Jeff Pagliuca, Laura Menninger, and Bobbi Sternheim.
